titleStmt.title: Two letters: the first, being a relation of a sad accident that fell out at Erpingham neer Norwich July 2. shewing how a fire-ball fell from the heavens into the parish church there, broke down part of the steeple and several places in the church-wall, kill'd one man and wounded diverse, &c. The second, being a relation of a strange sight in the heavens, seen by three justices of the peace their sons. Dated, Hungerford in Wiltshire, June 19. 1665.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for L. Chapman in Exchange-Alley, in Corn hill,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C..
